title: 103_hr5098
content: The "Fort Peck Tribes- Montana Compact Act of 1994" approves and ratifies the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, along with agreements related to water rights. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for the delivery, use, or transfer of water rights confirmed in the Tribes by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, with approval from the Secretary. The Secretary must approve or disapprove a Water Agreement within 180 days of submission. The Secretary must approve or disapprove a Water Agreement within 180 days of submission, or within 60 days after compliance with environmental laws. Parties can enforce the agreement under section 1361 of title 28, United States Code. The Department of the Interior must keep information on Water Agreements confidential. The Department of the Interior controls Water Agreements and financial benefits for Tribes. Tribes cannot authorize tribal water rights outside the Basin. An "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for economic development. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for tribal economic development. The Secretary of the Treasury deposits 10% of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project into the fund, not exceeding $50,000,000 annually. Interest accrued on deposits is available for use by the Secretary of the Interior for tribal economic development. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for tribal economic development, including long-term profit-making opportunities and employment for tribal members. Payments are made for land acquisition and improvement, subject to Secretary approval. Deposited amounts are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable, and payments do not affect federal services or programs for the Tribes or their members. The "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for tribal economic development, with payments not subject to income tax and not affecting power rates. Moneys in the fund cannot be distributed on a per capita basis. The Tribes waive claims against the United States in exchange for actions required by the Act. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact defines reserved water rights for the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Reservation. The Reservation refers to the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The Tribes are the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. Tribal water right is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The term "tribal water right" refers to the water right defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact. The term "Fund" pertains to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund.
